title: Trump's economy defies dire predictions as critics backpeddle on recession claims
text: 'The Big Money Show' panel discusses President Donald Trump's humming economy as tariff detractors start to backpeddle on recession claims. #foxbusiness #bigmoneyshow

title: September is in play for Fed cut, says Paul McCulley
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman with Paul McCulley, former PIMCO chief economist, join 'The Exchange' to discuss the next Fed chair, odds of a September rate cut and expectations for tomorrow's Fed meeting.

title: Consumer confidence rebounds but the economy is in a ‘quiet recession'
text: Danielle DiMartino Booth, CEO, QI Research, explains why the economy may not be as strong as it appears on the surface. Transcript: CAROLINE WOODS: Danielle, you've talked about some of the data points that warrant these rate cuts.

title: US consumer finance watchdog says it will replace Biden-era 'open banking' regulations
text: The top U.S. watchdog for consumer finance asked a federal court on Tuesday to pause an industry lawsuit seeking to strike down open banking regulations adopted by the prior Biden administration so the agency will have time to put forward a new version, court papers showed.

title: The market is too complacent on short-term impact of tariffs, says Cantor's Eric Johnston
text: Eric Johnston, Cantor Fitzgerald chief equity, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss the impact of tariffs on markets and the risk of a market reset.

title: US Labor Market Shows Signs of Cooling as Job Openings Drop
text: The U.S. labor market maintained stability in June, though signals of cooling are emerging amid shifting sectoral dynamics. The latest Jobs Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS) reported job openings at 7.4 million for June, a decrease of about 275,000 from May and steady year-over-year.

title: U.S.-China tariff pause extension not final until Trump signs off, trade negotiators say
text: A potential extension of a tariff pause between the United States and China will not be final until President Donald Trump signs off on the plan, U.S. negotiators said. Top trade officials for the two countries have concluded talks in Stockholm, Sweden, their third round of high-level discussions since May.

title: Sector Ratings For ETFs And Mutual Funds: Q3 2025
text: Consumer Non-cyclicals, Telecom Services, and Financials sectors currently earn Attractive-or-better ratings, making them top picks for quality sector fund exposure. My sector ratings combine stock-level fundamentals and valuation, emphasizing both strong business quality and reasonable costs for investors.

title: Trump's EU trade deal is based on massive energy purchases that are unlikely to materialize, analysts say
text: The European Union has pledged to buy $750 billion of energy from the U.S. in exchange for a lower tariff rate under its trade deal with President Donald Trump. But the bloc would have to triple its annual energy imports from the U.S. to meet the purchase target.

title: Josh Brown's "Best Stocks in the Market:" Utilities
text: Josh Brown, CEO of Ritholtz Wealth Management, joins CNBC's "Halftime Report" to detail some names joining his "Best Stocks in the Market."

title: Trump tariffs: Major multi-national firm to 'absorb' massive charge instead of raising prices
text: Philips CEO Roy Jakobs joins 'Varney & Co.' to discuss the impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs on the health-technology sector. #foxbusiness #varney

title: S&P500 Today: Nervous US Stock Market Eyes Fed Policy Outlook and September Cut Odds
text: S&P500 dips as weak earnings and tariff concerns weigh. Traders eye Fed policy signals and odds of a rate cut in September.

title: GDP is ready to pop, but not because the U.S. economy is popping
text: Here's how to read the second-quarter report on gross domestic product.

title: Trump's tariffs head back to court: What to know
text: Trade deals like the U.S.-European Union agreement could be at risk from a case winding its way through courts in the U.S.

title: The bad-news-is-good-news stock market
text: Take falling corporate profits, which would normally be bearish. But not in the second quarter of this year, during which the S&P 500's SPX-0.20% estimated calendar 2025 earnings per share fell nearly 10%.

title: Magnificent 7 Diverge as Peak Earnings Season Spotlights Big Tech
text: Peak earnings season for the second quarter begins this week and lasts through the second week of August. This is when roughly 75% of S&P 500 companies are scheduled to report.

title: Path Ahead For Markets As U.S. Strikes Trade Deals
text: Benefits from U.S. tax policy may balance negative tariff impact. Still sever uncertainties on the trade front going forward.

title: AI Is Just One Reason Stocks Are Pricey. They're Still a Buy.
text: Investors using only valuation to pick stocks could prove “arrogant or incompetent,” according to Trivariate Research President Adam Parker.

title: Why the Stock Market Is At Record Highs
text: The S&P 500 (NYSEARCA: SPY) and Nasdaq 100 (NASDAQ: QQQ) continue to drive this market higher. Note how far above the price is from their respective July 6-month calendar range highs (horizontal green line).

title: IMF's Gourinchas Says Tariffs Are Causing Tepid Growth
text: International Monetary Fund Chief Economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas discusses the IMF's 2025 global growth forecast on "Bloomberg Open Interest." The IMF sees global growth decelerating to 3% in 2025 from 3.3% last year amid disruption from President Donald Trump's attempts to rewire commerce.
